title: Trump nominates Kevin Warsh to head US Federal Reserve
subhead: If confirmed by the Senate, the 55-year-old economist will take up one of the most prestigious roles in global finance.

title: China's crackdown on a village of defiant Christians
FBI seizure of 2020 Georgia ballots rekindles fears of Trump retaliation over election loss
France's economy grew slightly more than expected in 2025
subhead: The country's gross domestic product rose by 0.9% in 2025, with 0.2% growth in the fourth quarter, the national statistics agency said on Friday.

title: Paris mayoral election: Sophia Chikirou hopes to capitalize on radical left's recent scores
subhead: In 2022, 30% of Parisians voted for Jean-Luc Mélenchon in the presidential election. But La France Insoumise holds no seats in the outgoing Council of Paris.

title: Paris reaches the pinnacle of haute couture
subhead: Valentino, Robert Wun, Ronald van der Kemp and Viktor & Rolf unveiled their collections with spectacular staging and at unusual venues.

title: Yuri Dmitriev, the Russian historian imprisoned for denouncing Kremlin attempts to rewrite history
subhead: Detained in a penal colony in Mordovia, the 70-year-old historian, who specializes in the Stalin regime's crimes, is one of Russia's oldest political prisoners. His crime? Refusing to accept historical falsifications that the Kremlin aims to impose on public opinion.

title: French PM Lecornu forces final budget through Parliament without vote

'Europe's housing crisis is a democratic time bomb'

Trump's new border chief vows 'smarter' operation in Minneapolis
Morocco unveils plans for giant film city on outskirts of Rabat
US Senate rejects vote to avert government shutdown
US eases Venezuela sanctions after oil sector reforms
Former Kurdish-led fighters and Damascus test a fragile 'reconciliation' in northeastern Syria
PFAS: Pollution in the EU could cost up to €1.7 trillion
'The only thing left to do is leave': Cuba pushed to the brink
subhead: 'Cuba, an island adrift' (2/3). Since the wave of unrest that swept the country in 2021, more than two million Cubans have fled. Those who remain on the island scrape by with varying degrees of success, as the exorbitant price of basic goods has become a source of inequality between those with nothing and those with access to foreign currency.

title: Denmark's long and difficult reckoning with America's abandonment
subhead: Since the end of the Cold War, the Scandinavian kingdom pursued a 'super-Atlanticist' strategy in hopes that the US would come to its aid when needed. Now, trust between Washington and Copenhagen has been broken.

title: Charles Kushner, Trump's man in Paris
subhead: The 71-year-old US ambassador, who took up his post in May 2025, is the father of Jared Kushner, Donald Trump's son-in-law and envoy to the Middle East. Like his son, he is known for his unorthodox methods and does not hesitate to interfere in France's domestic affairs.

title: The duty of solidarity with the Iranian people
John Bolton: 'Toppling the Iranian regime is the most effective way to remove the terrorist threat the West has faced'
The need to speak truth about immigration
